Detailed Description

Header file for SHA engine block.

Enumeration Type Documentation

enum Sha_Flags_t

SHA option flags.

Enumerator
SHA_NO_FLAGS 

No flags.

SHA_REVERSE_OUTPUT_FLAG 

Flag indicating that the output digest bytes should be reversed after the SHA operation compeltes. This is to accomodate different endianness requirements.

SHA_ASYNC_MODE_FLAG 

Flag indicating that SHA operations be performed in asynchronous mode. This causes the API to return while the current SHA operation is still in progress.

Function Documentation

void Sha256 ( const void *  message,
size_t  length,
Ptr_Msg256_t  digest,
uint32_t  flags 
)

Run SHA 256 to generate 256-bit digest.

Description: Exercise the SHA engine to output a 256 bit hash.

Parameters
messagePointer to the message to be hashed. Will be copied into shared memory (i.e. HSP accessible) if necessary.
lengthLength of the message.
digestPointer to output buffer to receive the digest output. (Does not need to be in shared memory.)
flagsCombination of Sha_Flags_t values to further control the behavior of the SHA operation. NOTE: Asynchronous mode is not available with this API.
Returns
void
void Sha256ProvideData ( const void *  data,
size_t  length 
)

Provide a buffer of data for a SHA 256 procedure.

Description: Provides a buffer of data for a currently in-progress SHA256 procedure, which will have beeen started with a call to Sha256StartNew. This API can work asynchronously. It will wait for any previous HSP operation to complete before starting processing of this buffer, and will return before the processing is complete. Thus it will be necessary to call Sha256WaitComplete before accessing the result.

Parameters
dataPointer to data to hash. Must be in shared memory (i.e. HSP accessible). Must also be a mutliple of SHA_BLOCK_SIZE bytes (64 bytes) unless it is the final buffer to be hashed.
lengthLength of buffer, in bytes.
Returns
void
void Sha256StartNew ( size_t  messageLength,
uint32_t  flags 
)

Begin a new SHA 256 procedure.

Description: Indicates the start of a new SHA256 procedure (asynchronously chained SHA256 operations). It is expected that Sha256ProvideData will be called repeatedly until messageLength bytes have been received.

Parameters
messageLengthTotal length of data to be hashed, in bytes.
flagsCombination of Sha_Flags_t values to further control the behavior of the SHA procedure.
Returns
void
void Sha256WaitComplete ( void  )

Wait for a SHA 256 procedure to complete.

Description: Waits for any in-progress SHA256 procedure to complete. Once this API returns, the final resulting hash value will be available in shared memory (see SHARED_SHA256_DIGEST_PTR) and ready for functions such as ShackEccVerifySignature.

Returns
void
void ShaExecuteCmd ( bool  waitCompletion)

Execute a SHA command.

Description: Executes a SHA command (prepared by calling ShaPrepareCmd), optionally waiting for it to complete.

Returns
void
void ShaInit ( void  )

Initialize the SHA block.

Description: Initializes the SHA block so that it is ready to receive commands. This basically just involves waiting for the hardware to come out of reset.

Parameters
void
Returns
void
void ShaPrepareCmd ( uint32_t  shaCommand,
Ptr_Msg256_t  digest,
uint32_t  byteCount,
uint32_t  messageBytes,
const void *  message,
ConstPtr_Msg256_t  initialDigest 
)

Prepare a SHA command.

Description: Prepares a SHA command (in shared memory) using the given parameters so that it is ready for execution.

Parameters
shaCommandSHA command code as defined in hspcmd.h.
digestPointer to where the first byte of final digest should be written. Caller is responsible for allocating memory. No address alignment requirements.
byteCountUsed as 'message length' for padding. Only valid for AUTOPAD commands, ignore otherwise.
messageBytesSize of message to be hashed. Must be a non-zero multiple of SHA_BLOCK_SIZE bytes (64 bytes) for non-AUTOPAD commands. Any byte count, including zero, for AUTOPAD commands.
messagePointer to the first byte of message for engine to hash. Message must be in contiguous memory. No address alignment requirements.
initialDigestPointer to the first byte of initial digest. Initial digest must be in contiguous memory. Only valid for LOAD commands, ignore otherwise. No address alignment requirements.
Returns
void
void ShaWaitCmdComplete ( void  )

Wait for a SHA command to complete.

Description: Waits for a SHA command (from calling ShaExecuteCmd with waitCompletion set to false) to complete before returning.

Returns
void
